alert.note: Alert for Grays Harbor (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 08 at 12:28PM PST until January 11 at 8:23AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Washington... Chehalis River At Porter affecting Grays Harbor County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chehalis River At Porter. * WHEN...Until Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 52.0 feet, the Chehalis River in Grays Harbor will cause major near record flooding from Oakville downstream to Grays Harbor. Deep and swift flood waters will inundate numerous farms and roads...including SR 12. High tidal levels at Aberdeen will worsen flooding along the lower reaches. Flooding will occur all along the river including headwaters...tributaries...and other streams within and near the Chehalis River Basin. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM PST Saturday the stage was 51.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:45 AM PST Saturday was 51.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 52.5 feet late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 48.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 830 PM PST.
